text: [Music]
I'm a preacher who teaches as opposed to
a teacher who
preaches I am everything that I am is
defined by my Christian belief and my
Christian
experience and everything I do stems
from that whether it's preaching or
teaching uh or counseling or whatever
else goes with the territory people have
asked me well what are you how would you
define yourself what is your your
ultimate label and my ultimate label is
a believing Christian that's what I am
my mind is not on hold uh my mind is uh
an interesting place reasonably well
furnished and it ranges up and down a
host of
avenues but uh I continue to hold fast
to the faith in which I was brought up
and I like to present it as an
interesting challenge to people who are
smarter than I am that's the fun of
being the Harvard preacher I preach to
people who are infinitely smarter than I
am I know more than they do but they are
smarter than I am and that is great fun
trying to take them as far as you can
before they overtake
you I think I'm a very literate preacher
I like language I love words and I like
to make words dance and do things and I
like to cause people to think about how
these these words uh are contributing to
these ideas and for words to dance in
their own heads so in that sense I it's
an odd description but I think I'm a a
wordy preacher words are very important
to me the right word at the right time
fitly spoken in my view as the most
powerful engine on Earth so I take very
great care with the words and the
language I use and how I put words
together and I think it's no accident
that one of great Greek words logos
means word and Jesus is often described
as the word the word incarnate I'm an
incarnational preacher I try to bring
words ideas and Concepts to life and
that's for me the glory of language the
glory of of rhetoric that's what I do
